byline.original: By SARAH M. KAZADI and REBECCA SESNY

abstract: Citizens of Democratic Republic of Congo protest latest attempt by Pres Joseph Kabila to delay 2016 elections; complain Kabila wants to carve country’s 11 provinces into 26 to extend local and provincial elections and keep himself in power by sliding into third term.
lead_paragraph: President Joseph Kabila is carving the country’s 11 provinces into 26, which many Congolese see as a ploy to delay the coming presidential election and allow Mr. Kabila to “slide” into a third term.

headline.main: Congolese See No End to President’s Final Term
headline.print_headline: Congolese See No End to Leader’s Final Term

snippet: President Joseph Kabila is carving the country’s 11 provinces into 26, which many Congolese see as a ploy to delay the coming presidential election and allow Mr. Kabila to “slide” into a third term.
